job_title: Analytics & Sciences Manager, Machine Learning & Labeling
job_Description: About Pinterest : Millions of people across the world come to Pinterest to find new ideas every day. It's where they get inspiration, dream about new possibilities and plan for what matters most. Our mission is to help those people find their inspiration and create a life they love. In your role, you'll be challenged to take on work that upholds this mission and pushes Pinterest forward. You'll grow as a person and leader in your field, all the while helping Pinners make their lives better in the positive corner of the internet.  Our new progressive work model is called PinFlex, a term that's uniquely Pinterest to describe our flexible approach to living and working. Visit our  PinFlex  landing page to learn more. Employees across the company are building toward the strategic vision - improving the quality of the product, engagement with our platform, creating and evolving experiences: for Pinners to browse, save, and shop, for Creators to build, for Advertisers to reach their customers. They build and refine these ideas, evaluate them and launch when it's beneficial to do so. But what if every person in the company could realize 10 times the impact they have today, by testing more ideas, getting feedback faster, and learning how to make each idea more impactful? That's the goal of the Data Platforms Science team.  Using Pinterest's Machine Learning platform, engineers train about 10,000 models each week and deploy hundreds of these to production. We have tools to collect human labels on hundreds of thousands of questions each week and use these to create training sets, compare the performance of models, or evaluate the state of our product. We have tools to survey tens of thousands of Pinners and ask for their perspective. Yet nearly everyone using these tools is doing so in isolation, using their own knowledge and skills to achieve the best performance for their use-cases. We're approaching an inflection point where we can begin to unlock learnings from the aggregation of these individual efforts to improve the utility of the platform.  We are looking for a highly technical data scientist who is passionate about mentorship, machine learning, platforms & tools to manage, lead and develop a small team of data scientists to understand the opportunities, prototype solutions, and transform the pace of innovation with these tools at Pinterest.   What you'll do:   Apply data science and analytics  to identify opportunities to improve our machine learning and human labeling platforms, and prototype solutions that measurably improve the outcomes for the platforms  Build a roster of high-impact analytical opportunities  and engage with your team to deliver high-quality analyses to steer and drive action  Lead, mentor and grow a team  of talented data scientists by providing continuous and candid feedback and recognizing individual strengths and contributions  Build processes and solutions  to improve the quality, rigor and agility of analyses  Investigate key questions  that will unlock improvements in productivity such as: Can we automate recommendations that will improve the performance of a trained model? Can we predict the gains seen in online A/B tests?  Can we collect 10x fewer training labels and achieve the same model performance?  Evolve our machine learning, human evaluation, and in-app survey strategy  in close partnership with product and engineering leaders by building on the learnings uncovered by your team and shaping the infrastructure necessary to collect the data needed at scale   What we're looking for:   10+ years of combined post-graduate academic and industry experience applying scientific methods to solve real-world problems on web-scale data 2+ years experience managing and up-leveling other data scientists or product analysts  Demonstrated execution and impact on cross-functional initiatives, strong communication skills, and a track record of influencing leaders and peers using data  Self-propelled continuous learner who keeps up with new tools and methodologies and builds prototypes with concepts learned  Expertise in machine learning and at least one scripting language (ideally Python)  Strong business and product sense who can shape vague questions into well-defined analyses and success metrics that drive business decisions  The best candidates will also have:  Strong focus on understanding opportunities to improve the performance of ML training or evaluation and examples working with human-labeled data.  Experience with experimentation at web scale and familiarity with its pitfalls  Experience landing initiatives that cross organizational boundaries  Demonstrated execution in the strategic analytics side of data science, shaping critical decisions and outcomes  A mastery of SparkSQL/Hive   Our Commitment to Diversity:  At Pinterest, our mission is to bring everyone the inspiration to create a life they love—and that includes our employees. We’re taking on the most exciting challenges of our working lives, and we succeed with a team that represents an inclusive and diverse set of identities and backgrounds.  Not Specified 0

job_title: Managing Consultant / Senior Managing Consultant (Data Science)
job_Description: JOB TITLE:  Managing Consultant / Senior Managing Consultant            STATUS:  Exempt, 40 hours per week            LOCATION:  Offices in Madison, WI; Tucson, AZ; San Diego, CA; Washington, DC           Remote candidates will be considered and will be required to travel to hub offices occasionally.         CULTURE AND COMMITMENT AT ILLUME      Our Vision:  ILLUME is the premier consultancy for advancing, re-envisioning, and equitably transforming the energy industry. We align with clean energy and social justice imperatives and give primacy to human dreams and aspirations so that all can thrive in a clean energy future.      Our Commitment to Team Values:  At ILLUME, we value the diverse lived experiences of our team. We view diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) as an on-going commitment and investment in the growth of our employees, the growth of our company culture, and the growth of our industry. By centering environmental justice, climate change mitigation, and social justice in our work, we aim to transform the way the energy industry looks at its challenges. We believe that our collective well-being depends on how well we explore, elevate, and communicate the experiences of all people who use the electric grid. We quantify the impacts of our public investments to reduce energy demand and mitigate climate change.      ILLUME considers our investment in our team as a long-term and mutual investment. At ILLUME, we’re committed to building a valued business while ensuring rewarding careers to our employees.

We're transforming the grocery industry  At Instacart, we invite the world to share love through food because we believe everyone should have access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together. Where others see a simple need for grocery delivery, we see exciting complexity and endless opportunity to serve the varied needs of our community. We work to deliver an essential service that customers rely on to get their groceries and household goods, while also offering safe and flexible earnings opportunities to Instacart Personal Shoppers.  Instacart has become a lifeline for millions of people, and we're building the team to help push our shopping cart forward. If you're ready to do the best work of your life, come join our table.  Introducing Our Hybrid Working Model  As the future of work evolves, so do we. We have a hybrid model where our roles are open to in-office, flex, or remote work. Learn more about our flexible approach to where we work. ABOUT THE ROLE  Instacart Data Scientists understand our customers and shoppers and continue to investigate and improve the experience with our product. It's about knowing which problems are critical to solve, and how much effort to invest in addressing them. You will be a trusted partner in uncovering barriers in the product's usability and utilize these insights to inform product improvements that drive angle-changing growth.  ABOUT THE TEAM  We are the "thought partners" and problem solvers for the company, dedicated to making grocery shopping effortless for everyone and finding solutions to large-scale opportunities that will forever change the way people feed themselves and their loved ones. Our teams work at the intersection of data and decisions. Data Scientists at Instacart are embedded within product teams and serve as the data driven thought leaders. We are currently seeking experienced data scientists to support these areas of our business:   Ads  Shopper, Marketplace & Fulfillment  Customer Growth and Experience  Retailers including Enterprise   ABOUT THE JOB   Own analytical frameworks that guide the product roadmap  Design rigorous experiments and interpret results to draw detailed and actionable conclusions  Develop statistical models to extract trends, measure results, and predict future performance of our product  Build simulations to project impact of various product and policy interventions  Enable objective decision making across the company by democratizing data through dashboards and other analytical tools  Use expertise in causal inference, machine learning, complex systems modeling, operations research, economics, etc. to shape the future of Instacart  We have a rich experimentation and a/b testing culture.  This is a fast-paced and constantly changing environment. Sometimes our problems are ambiguous and you must be ready to solve them quickly, are they ok with that? Better yet...do they thrive on that?   ABOUT YOU  MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS   6+ years experience working in data-driven analytics/predictive analytics/statistical modeling/data mining  Ability to run rigorous experiments and come up with scientifically sound recommendations  Ability to translate business needs into analytical frameworks  Ability to code in Python, R and write complex, efficient SQL queries to extract data  Experience with a/b testing and ability to run rigorous experiments to come up with scientifically sound recommendations  Good understanding of how to grow and shape data tools and datasets to improve data-driven decision making  Ability to thrive in an unstructured environment, working autonomously on a strong team to find opportunity and deliver business impact   PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS   PhD or MS in computer science, machine learning, statistics, physics  Bonus points but not required, having worked on Search ranking, Ad-tech, Risk or Fraud  Experience working on gig economy issues, multi-sided marketplaces, logistics, or e-commerce Experience building ML models   Experience in supply & demand shaping, logistics, pricing and other types of Marketplace project work  Interesting side projects or Kaggle competition results   #LI-Remote Accommodations & Accessibility  At Instacart, we strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you need assistance submitting an application through our career site due to a disability, please submit an Accommodations Request Form and someone from our team will reach out soon to see how we may be able to assist.

job_title: Sr. Data Analyst / Scientist - Product Analytics
job_Description: About Realtor.com  Come to work for Realtor.com! A leader in online real estate and backed by industry experience and the News Corp Brand, Realtor.com's vision is to be the leading destination to discover and create your perfect home, and today 100 million unique users visit our company's website and mobile apps monthly. What you can do at Realtor.com has the potential to touch people in a real and meaningful way. You'll engage with some of the best and the brightest coworkers and leaders, learn and contribute, and have a great time. We work hard, play hard, and recognize achievement – rewarding passion for innovation, creativity and quality. If you enjoy working in a fast paced, dynamic, cutting-edge work environment and desire to make a meaningful contribution to the business, then make the move!  The Role  Realtor.com currently has an opportunity for a Sr. Analyst, Product Analytics, reporting to the Director of Product Analytics for Buyer, Agent, and Concierge Experiences. Realtor.com is in the middle of aggressive strategic growth driven off of newly integrated entities, and continuing our record growth and consumer engagement will be critical to Realtor.com's strategic success in the industry. Specifically, this role's core responsibilities will focus on partnering directly with the major functions of the business to drive consumer engagement, conversion and overall optimization of the consumer's journey for our emerging product and service areas. There is a tremendous opportunity to make a huge impact in a short amount of time!  The role is central to Realtor.com's long-term strategic growth and will liaise with leadership across the major functions of the business on a real-time basis including, most notably, Product, Design, and Engineering within the Buyer, Agent, and Concierge Experiences product organization. This product helps consumers work with agents through the concierge process as they work through the later stages of finding, selecting, and buying a home.  An ideal candidate will have a background driving value through analysis of a combination of web analytics, product, and product functions as well as expertise/understanding grounded in long-term strategic business planning and the ability to influence executives and representatives from across the organization to achieve results in a disciplined manner. Specifically, the candidate should have familiarity or expertise in digital consumer/search businesses, consumer funnel optimization, consumer analytics/segmentation and experimentation. Experience within real estate tech, B2B sales, market research, and online shopping tools is a big plus. General responsibilities include decision support, AB testing analytics support, product development opportunity sizing, consumer behavior analysis, and performance management of Realtor.com's consumer internet business lines.  What will you do?  Responsibilities  Support the Product team in accomplishing the goals and objectives of the Consumer internet businesses. Develop and monitor KPIs to drive high-level oversight of business initiatives and company health, and develop regular insights from the data to enable performance management and facilitate accountability. Deliver high-quality data-driven business analyses that address business issues with effective solutions, and provide key insights leading to actionable recommendations. Partner with the Product organization on data-driven decision making, idea generation, and rigorous measurement. Lead exploratory analysis to identify and size product development opportunities to determine tradeoffs between product features that grow and optimize the product offering. Develop product learning agendas, design multivariate tests, and synthesize analytical results into practical recommendations that inform key business decisions. Partner with the engineering and business intelligence teams to drive improvements to tracking and data quality. Conduct deep-dive analyses to understand product performance, conduct complex initiatives that address key strategic questions and drive assorted ad hoc projects. Inform OKR development with product leadership.  What will you bring?  Requirements  Educational Requirements: BA/BS with undergraduate focus in Analytics, Finance, Statistics, Applied Math, Data Science, Economics or related field. Masters a plus. Differentiator: experience within real estate tech, real estate builder communities, market research and/or B2B sales. 5+ years' experience with increasing levels of responsibility; online media / consumer audience-oriented / consumer internet experience a plus. Strong analytical, critical thinking, decision-making and problem-solving skills. Experience in digital tools including Omniture and Google Analytics preferred; SQL experience required. Proven track record of translating business problems into analytical framework and developing analytical plans for answering complex problems and delivering analytic insights. Experience interfacing with technical resources with broad, multi-disciplinary expertise. Experience applying advanced analytical disciplines to financial, consumer audience/user experience, and/or product-level modeling, forecasting, regression, time series, etc. Business partnering and influencing skills. Superior presentation and communication skills; mature presence coupled with emotional intelligence. Ability to interact and communicate with individuals in various functional areas and various levels of management including top-level executives. Ability to remain flexible and thrive in a fast-paced and often hectic environment. Ability to thrive in ambiguous situations, and provide data-driven clarity to less technical audiences.  About Realtor.com  At realtor.com®, we believe that everyone deserves a home of their own. We're a community of nearly 2,000 employees who work hard to ensure that from the moment someone starts dreaming about a new home, to the moment they walk in the door and beyond, we're there to lend a helping hand. Every month, over 85 million people trust us with their journey home by visiting our site and mobile apps, and we'd love to have you join our team to help.  We've got great offices in the U.S. and Canada with lots of sweet jobs to choose from, so we're hoping you'll join us on our journey to make buying, selling, renting, and living in homes easier and more rewarding for everyone.  Let's make a difference, together. For Real.   #LI-IH1

The Challenge  At Digit, we are on a mission to make financial health effortless for everyone. We are building the world's first intelligent bank account to help millions of American consumers become financially healthy. Our challenge is clear: managing personal finances is hard. As of 2019, 70% of Americans struggle with at least one aspect of financial stability and over 40% don't have $400 in their savings account. We believe automation is our path to delivering our mission, and we are working towards it every day.   We have a collaborative, inclusive, and supportive culture and we look for people who are curious, ambitious, and mission-driven. If you're passionate about making an impact and helping real people every day we're excited to meet you!   The Role  We are looking for a passionate, curious and creative problem solver to be a Product Data Scientist at Digit, reporting to the Head of Data. Your role will be focused on democratizing product insights and using data to drive product strategy. If you're passionate about making a meaningful difference in people's lives in partnership with an agile, driven, and fun-loving team, we're excited to meet you.   Here are some ways you'll make an impact:  Analyze user behavior and product usage to proactively identify opportunities for product improvements  Design experiments to assess hypotheses  Build dashboards to communicate data insights  Partner with Product Managers to define product KPIs & priorities  Deliver analysis in a format that can help drive business decisions by both executive leadership and partnering Product Managers  Continuously improve Digit's tracking and reporting processes to ensure high data accuracy & robust product understanding  Are you the candidate we are looking for?  You have at least 3 years of experience in a related role  You have extensive hands-on experience with SQL and data visualization  You're able to develop quantitative analysis, ad-hoc reports, and models to derive meaning from raw data in order to influence product decisions and direction  You have strong communications skills and ability to present work to executive staff  You're a self-starter with ownership attitude with an enthusiasm to work in a fast-paced, start-up environment  You understand statistical principles (eg. statistical significance, sample size)  Who We Are:  We want to eliminate the stress and anxiety people feel about their finances so they can focus on what's most important in their lives. We first mastered saving for near-term goals, helping members automatically save over $7 billion. Today, we are harnessing machine learning technology to give our members the first intelligent bank account that manages all of their personal finances.   We're committed to doing the best work of our lives together. Come see if Digit is right for you.   What We Offer You:  Competitive salary and RSUs  100% paid medical, dental, & vision benefits  100% paid life & disability insurance  Fertility reimbursement  Daily lunch stipend  Internet, commuter, and wellness benefits  Take what you need PTO policy  401k plan  Flexible, hybrid work environment  Digit is a proud equal opportunity employer and we believe that a diverse and inclusive workforce is an imperative. We welcome people of different backgrounds, genders, races, ethnicities, abilities, sexual orientations, and perspectives. We don't discriminate based upon any protected class and we encourage candidates of all identities and backgrounds to apply. Digit considers qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.   Digit is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at recruiting@digit.co.

Who we are  Atreca is an integrated biotechnology company located in San Carlos, CA in the San Francisco Bay Area. We apply our proprietary drug discovery platform to profile clinically relevant, active B cell responses in patients receiving successful treatment and, in turn, develop a portfolio of antibody therapeutics against novel tumor targets with the potential to treat large patient populations. Atreca seeks talented, driven individuals who are dedicated to making a positive impact on human health and are motivated to become key members of a growing biotechnology company.  Position Summary  We are seeking a talented Data Analyst to design and develop reports and analyses from our R&D database. The information you deliver will drive key research and development decisions by scientific stakeholders. Your strong communication skills and scientific knowledge will enable you to work collaboratively with a diversity of cross functional scientific team members to develop meaningful, rich views of drug discovery data. In addition to directly creating such views using your expertise with reporting tools such as R markdown or shiny apps, you will serve as a liaison between the research team and the software engineering team, providing project management support and writing specifications for any engineering work required in support of reporting.  Duties and Responsibilities  In collaboration with scientists and other stakeholders, identify R&D data to capture in our database and develop reports and analyses  Maintain a prioritized list of reporting projects  Coordinate effort between stakeholders and software engineers to ensure on time development and delivery of reporting projects  Develop reports using R markdown or shiny apps  Train employees how to follow company standards and procedures when creating reports.  Develop reports for data quality cleaning and monitoring  Ensure high quality of reports, proactively detecting and resolving errors in reports   Required Skills and Qualifications Degree in Computer Science, or Biology related field  Minimum of 3 yrs informatics industry experience  Strong R, SQL and RDBMS skills  Previous experience in data reporting  Previous experience a Scientist or Analyst  Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills  Extensive computer software skills  Strong candidates will have training in statistics  Strong candidates will know Python or another scripting language   Exact title commensurate with experience. Atreca is an equal opportunity employer.

The Role Motiv is looking for a R&D Data Scientist III to join its Advanced R&D team as a key contributor. As part of a small team, you will distill business- and customer-critical information from various data sources, chiefly Motiv's extensive warehouse of vehicle field operations data. You will also work both independently and with others across Motiv to create tools and processes to help other stakeholders within and beyond Motiv more effectively use Motiv's data for decisions related to Motiv's electric vehicle systems and platforms. Responsibilities include market needfinding, diagnostic tools, data-driven evaluation of proposed problem solutions, modeling, verification of models, technology specification and prototyping. In your interdisciplinary collaboration with Motiv's engineering, operations, customer support, manufacturing and other teams you may find yourself as mentor, subject matter expert, advisor, implementation helper and/or project leader. The successful candidate will quickly develop data-driven models, insights and capabilities which enable our products and services to more effectively meet fleets' electrification needs. Candidates should enjoy data set manipulation and the programming to support it, talking with customers and building consensus across diverse stakeholders. As part of a small team within a small company, you will need to have an entrepreneurial mindset. We are dependent on our team members' leadership, enthusiasm, creative problem solving and self-motivation across a wide range of both technical and non-technical disciplines. These attributes are as important as the knowledge and skill set required for the work performed. Alignment with Motiv's values will be essential for your happiness and success in this role – Deep Passion for Freeing Fleets from Fossil Fuel, Curiosity, Customer Focus, Collaboration and Owning It. Will require occasional domestic travel. This position reports to the Chief Technology Officer. Responsibilities      Technology Application Needfinding: data analysis, customer interviews, vehicle ride-alongs and site visits with the goal to see beyond what even our customers see and synthesize new ideas for how data may be used to inform both identified and unidentified opportunities.    Work with our traditional suppliers and partners as well as established and startup companies in other industries and thought leaders in universities and government: stay current on the state of the art through ongoing dialog with all of the above; think creatively about how to evaluate, translate, adapt and extend the best of new data technology for meeting specific customer needs.    Consolidate requirements and build specifications: integrate market and technical information to build requirements for new data collection and processing, then work with Motiv's engineering team to create specifications which are achievable in commercial production in the field    Data processing: design and build functional data models and processes which may never have been done before in Motiv's market – or at all.    Manage new technology evaluation and prototyping projects related to data collection, storage, processing and use: plan project work, conduct gate reviews, bring in other Motiv resources and outside resources as needed, communicate and manage project outcomes.    Assist Motiv's development teams: participate in core development projects being carried out by Motiv's engineering, operations, support and manufacturing teams, especially those projects where an advanced data science perspective is required.    Help Motiv's sales and marketing team effectively access, process and use data in ways beneficial to prospective and current customers.    Adhere to Motiv company policies, procedures, and best-practices.     Required Experience and Skills      B.S. in Data Science, Computer Science or related field    Hands-on experience building prototypes, including database coding    Expertise in:    Database structures and queries, both relational and timeseries db experience    Data collection, models, analysis and reporting    Automation of data reporting    Post-processing and visualization of large datasets    Experience with market needfinding and application of technology with a design mindset    Experience with project management    Experience in Python or Matlab    Strong analytical and communications skills    Familiarity with AWS services, including, RDS, S3, Lambda functions, Quicksight, Tableau, and Athena or Kafka     Preferred Qualifications      MS in Design or related fields    PhD in Data Science, Computer Science or related fields with data-driven research    Experience bringing products to market through a product lifecycle    Experience with product requirements documentation and developing product specifications    Experience in the automotive or commercial vehicle industries    Familiarity with building data front-ends would be helpful.     Benefits & Perks      Competitive benefits package including Medical (including 24/7 online access to a physician), HSA, Vision, Dental and 401(k)    We offer a generous PTO policy, Group Universal Life, Voluntary Personal Accident and Voluntary Disability Insurance    11 Paid Holidays    Educational Assistance Employee Program    Healthy Work / Life Balance    Fresh daily snacks    Perks at Work - Discounted learning, tickets, electronics, travel, health, restaurants & retail    Free Online Training & Development    We are bicycle-friendly, with bicycle storage available to all Foster City employees with a 5 minute walk to the scenic Bay Front     Job Type: Full-time

We are looking for a highly motivated Data Analyst who is passionate about data to join BitTorrent’s team. You will partner with teams across the organization to uncover valuable insights, solve their data needs and to drive our business.   The ideal candidate will show a strong grasp of business models and statistics, excellent understanding of hypothesis testing, great analytical and problem-solving skills, and the ability to coherently describe technical concepts and analysis implications clearly to a wide audience.   Key Responsibilities      Develop informative analyses, data visualizations, dashboards, and reports to deliver business insights.    Provide analytic support and expertise in defining KPIs, specify technical data requirements, and ensure all product feature and initiative launches have proper metric tracking.    Own A/B testing measurements: Design measurement frameworks, summarize insights, and recommend strategic decisions based on data to improve the performance of our organization.    Apply a diverse set of tactics including statistics and quantitative reasoning to solve problems.     Key Skills      Bachelor’s degree Business, Mathematics, Statistics, or other analytical field    3+ of professional experience as a Data Analyst    Advanced SQL skills and experience with relational databases    Knowledge of statistics and data science concepts    Experience with R or Python is a big plus    Strong communication skills and comfortable presenting data clearly to audience of all levels    Proficiency in BI dashboards and visualization tools is a plus (Tableau, Data Studio, Google Analytics, Advanced Excel)     Job Type: Full-time   Pay: Up to $120,000.00 per year   Benefits:      401(k) matching    Dental insurance    Flexible spending account    Health insurance    Health savings account    Life insurance    Referral program    Retirement plan    Vision insurance     Schedule:      Monday to Friday     Supplemental Pay:      Bonus pay     Ability to commute/relocate:      San Francisco, CA 94108: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)     Application Question(s):      Will you now or in the future require visa sponsorship?     Experience:      SQL: 2 years (Required)    Python or R: 1 year (Required)     Work Location: One location

This is a leadership position in an applied science role designing algorithms to address three core problems that our customers encounter when shopping on Wayfair:  1) They shop the Wayfair sites and find multiple products that appear to be some type of duplicate of one another -  duplicate matching  2) They try to cross-shop products and find the same item on 1+ other sites with different pricing, merchandising, and delivery information -  competitor matching  3) They try to find the product on the Wayfair sites and cannot. They can find the product on 1+ other sites -  selection gaps  These three problems are further exacerbated by the fact that the Wayfair catalog consists of tens of millions of products in a competitive landscape of many hundreds of millions of products. We need a way to map this entire universe of products to address each of these problems in a way that is  fast ,  cost-efficient ,  complete , and  accurate . This mapping is based on exact, objective relationships between products - a given product is identical based on specific criteria or completely unique when compared to another set. This framing can be applied within a catalog of products (e.g., Wayfair) or between catalogs (Wayfair-Amazon, Amazon-Walmart, supplier-Wayfair, etc.).  What You’ll Do   Provide technical leadership in the development of an intelligent product matching system by advancing the state-of-the-art in machine (and deep) learning techniques to support  duplicate matching ,  competitor matching , and  selection gaps .  Setup offshore human-in-the-loop experiments and deploy promising ideas quickly and broadly, managing deadlines and deliverables while applying the latest theories to develop new and improved products, processes, or technologies.  Keep abreast of relevant research in search query, information retrieval, and relevance ranking. Maintain expert knowledge in computer science, machine (and deep) learning, data mining, natural language processing, active learning, large-scale optimization techniques and more.  Engage in broader strategy and execution discussions in the Data Science Organization, providing input from your program experiences to enhance our priorities across the board.  Work with cross-functional teams of product managers, engineers, scientists, and analysts, to devise implementation and experimentation strategies.  Actively contribute to the wider data science and machine-learning community by sharing and publishing your findings within Wayfair and through collaborations.  About Wayfair Inc.  Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.  No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or genetic information.

Sr. Data Scientist     ** ONLY APPLY IF LOCATED IN THE US**     Chronus Health, a medical diagnostic company, is on a mission to build a global point-of-care platform for all standard blood tests. We are a company-in-residence at Fogarty Innovation, based on the campus of El Camino Hospital in Mountain View, California.     Chronus Health is a fast-paced start-up expanding its engineering team. We are looking for an energetic and experienced individual to join our research and development team. The primary function of this role is focused on algorithm development for our hematology platform. This individual will report directly to the Director of Software Engineering & Data Science and be an integral part of building a fast-growing team and driving the platform execution. If you believe in pushing the boundaries and changing the status quo to impact the healthcare industry significantly, we would love to hear from you.     Position description     This position is within the core data science and software team, working on algorithm development for the hematology product and data analytics evaluating health information for diverse patient populations.     You will be developing the algorithms to analyze data coming from the Chronus Health hematology platform at the core of the next generation of point-of-care medical diagnostic devices.     Primary Responsibilities:         Review large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns      Ability to initiate and drive projects from conception to completion with minimal guidance and deliver superior performance      Provide ML leadership and mentorship through code reviews and technical discussions      Create predictive models and machine-learning algorithms      Modify and combine different models through ensemble modeling      Organize and present information using data visualization techniques      Analyze existing and development method data to identify workflow and protocol improvements.      Develop and suggest solutions and strategies to business challenges      Collaborate with system engineering and software engineers to build analysis pipelines and integrate new testing methods, data, and insights into analytical workflows.        Basic Qualifications:         M.S in the fields of Computer Science, Data Science, Applied Mathematics, or Statistics      4+ years of hands-on experience in classification modeling, predictive modeling, data science, and data analysis      4+ years of programming experience in python or similar is required      3+ years of experience working with Artificial Neural Networks (ANN) and Convolutional Neural Network(CNN)      Experience with supervised and unsupervised machine learning approaches, including but not limited to classification, regression, clustering models, and other forms of anomaly detection/pattern recognition      Experience working with relational and non-relational databases      Experience working in the agile development process        Preferred Qualifications:         Ph.D. in a highly quantitative field (Statistics, Applied Mathematics or Computer Science)      Experience with setting up DevOps for ML infrastructure on the cloud and local infrastructure is a plus.

Introduction      Watson Orders is a IBM Silicon Valley based technology development group targeting the development of world-class conversational AI. Our mission is to deliver advanced technology solutions that address real-world, data driven needs in a customer-facing the quick service restaurant, environment. We are focused on using state-of-the-art Machine Learning, AI, and related technologies to completely transform the customer experience!              Your Role and Responsibilities      We are seeking to hire a Lead ML Engineer to join our growing team! This is hands-on technical role where you will spend most of your time designing, coding, and implementing ML solutions to intent and understanding problems, with an overlay of research and mentorship of other hardworking engineers. We are looking for someone who has extensive experience and expertise in designing and implementing ML training pipelines as we improve and scale our conversational AI products. As a Lead ML Engineer, you will serve as an ML specialist and guide other engineers to tackle complex algorithmic and architectural challenges.              You will:                    Investigate and experiment with new model architectures to improve existing ML models, training pipelines, and run-time inference performance      Creatively balance the demands of production-level software engineering with exploratory research and development      Work with teams to develop and improve ML pipelines that go all the way from R&D to at-scale deployment               Required Technical and Professional Expertise                Extensive experience working with large production codebases       Experience using PyTorch, MxNet, TensorFlow, or similar tools       Hands-on experience with ML model deployment and inference in a production environment       Experience with sequence-to-sequence neural networks (e.g. LSTMs, GRUs, Transformers, etc) in any domain                        Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise               Experience developing production-level Python       Ability to build NLP data pipelines and perform data transformations to fit deep learning models for language learning or understanding       Experience with MLOps and/or ML at scale                           About Business Unit      IBM’s Cloud and Cognitive software business is committed to bringing the power of IBM’s Cloud and Watson/AI technologies to life for our clients and ecosystem partners around the world. IBM provides you with the most comprehensive and consistent approach to development, security and operations across hybrid environments—with complete software solutions for business and IT operations, development, data science, security, and management. Our experts and software capabilities help organizations develop applications once and deploy them anywhere, integrate security across the breadth of their IT estate, and automate operations with management visibility. With IBM, you also have access to new skills and methods, governance and management approaches, and a deep ecosystem of industry experts and partners.               This job requires you to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated prior to your start date, where legally permissible. Proof of vaccination status will be required. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical, pregnancy or religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable law.                      Your Life @ IBM      Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.          Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.          It's time to define your career.                      About IBM      IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.          Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.           At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.                      Location Statement      IBM offers a wide range of resources for eligible IBMers to thrive both inside and outside of work. In addition to a competitive benefits program consisting of medical and life insurance, retirement plans, and time off, eligible employees may also have access to:                    12 weeks of paid parental bonding leave. Family care options are also available to support eligible employees during COVID-19.      World-class training and educational resources on our personalized, AI-driven learning platform. IBM's learning culture supports your restless attitude to grow your skills and build the depth and scale of knowledge needed to achieve your career goals.      Well-being programs to support mental and physical health.      Financial programs that empower you to plan, save, and manage your money (including expert financial counseling, 401(k), IBM stock discount, etc.).      Select educational reimbursement opportunities.      Diverse and inclusive employee resource groups where you can network and connect with IBMers across the globe.      Giving and volunteer programs to benefit charitable organizations and local communities.      Discounts on retail products, services, and experiences.          We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.                      Being You @ IBM      IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

For more than 20 years, AEG has played a pivotal role in transforming sports and live entertainment. Annually, we host more than 160 million guests, promote more than 10,000 shows and present more than 22,000 events around the world. We are committed to innovation, artistry, and community, and leverage the power of our 300+ venues, leading sports franchises, marquee music brands, integrated entertainment districts, premier ticketing platform and global sponsorship activations, to create memorable moments that give the world reason to cheer.  Our business is interwoven with the human mind and heart, and we strive to build a diverse and inclusive company that reflects the artists, athletes, and fans that we host; reach beyond traditional boundaries to support the communities in which we operate; and minimize our impact on the environment by adopting sustainable practices throughout our business operations.  If you want to be challenged to up your game and make a difference, then join us in giving the world reason to cheer!  Position Summary:  We are seeking a Senior Data Scientist to join the Strategy team at AEG Presents. We are a rapidly growing team at the world's leading live entertainment company, with a portfolio including such iconic festivals as Coachella and Stagecoach, global tours for top artists such as The Rolling Stones, Taylor Swift, and Ed Sheeran, and a worldwide network of premier venues.  The return of concerts has brought unprecedented opportunity, and a growing need for intellectually curious data lovers to uncover new insights in an exciting time for our industry. Working with all management levels of the Strategy team, this highly impactful role will take the lead on developing advanced analytics to guide business decision making and empower our people to bring unique live experiences to the world.  Essential Functions:   Develop predictive and statistical models using data and programming tools (e.g. SQL, Python, R) to improve business performance to deliver insights on customer behavior and trends that help drive decisions across marketing, ticketing, artist deals, pricing and other core business areas.  Work collaboratively with Strategy team to determine data needs and help design, prepare, clean, and maintain large transactional, inventory, financial and other data sets.  Work with product and data engineering teams to operationalize analytical models into business products and services serving internal and external customers.  Communicate insights and recommendations to Strategy team and gather and incorporate feedback from executive stakeholders across the company.   Required Qualifications:   Education minimum of BA/BS Degree (4-year), preferably in a quantitative field; Masters or other relevant advanced degree preferred.  5-7 years of professional experience in data science or a related field.  Applied experience with the tools and technologies used for data science projects, statistical model building, programming, and working with large data sets (Python, R, SQL, or equivalent).  Knowledge of data visualization/reporting tools (Excel, Power BI, Tableau, or equivalent) with the ability to present analysis in clear and compelling fashion.  Strong understanding of data science principles and statistical knowledge, with a technical ability to conduct advanced analytics such as forecasting, hypothesis/significance testing, A/B testing, regression analysis, and machine learning.  Strong quantitative and critical thinking skills, with a passion for discovering and delivering useful insights from large and diverse data sets, and ability to translate ambiguous problems into hypotheses that can be tested, measured, and validated.  Good communication skills, with the ability to discuss technical concepts in plain language and collaborate effectively on complex analytics.  Ability and initiative to drive projects forward independently and figure out the best way to solve challenging problems.  Music knowledge and passion for live entertainment are a plus.  Experience working on a data science or analytical team in a consumer-facing business preferred.   AEG reserves the right to change or modify the employee's job description whether orally or in writing, at any time during the employment relationship. AEG may require an employee to perform duties outside his/her normal description.

ALL SOURCEGRAPH ROLES ARE FULLY REMOTE  Who we are  Our mission at Sourcegraph is to make it so that everyone can code, not just ~0.1% of the population. We help developers and companies with billions of lines of code create the software you use every day. In enabling more people to code, we believe we will create economic opportunity across the world and will drive progress that benefits everyone.  It's an exciting time to join Sourcegraph. Our company is growing rapidly: we've experienced exponential growth and our $125M Series D from Andreessen Horowitz and $50M Series C from Sequoia have given us the opportunity to make big ambitious bets on our future. We have a huge market (every company that builds software) and massive opportunity (most developers haven't even heard of code search yet, but once you've used it, you can't live without it-just like Google web search). By continuing to hire exceptional people, we have the opportunity to make Sourcegraph one of the biggest technology companies in the world. Working hours  Given that we are an all-remote company and hire   almost anywhere  in the world, we don't have a particular time-zone preference for this role.  Why this job is exciting  Sourcegraph's Data & Analytics team empowers every part of the business with the data infrastructure and insights they need to make great decisions.  As a Senior Data Analyst at Sourcegraph, you will be a vital member of the Data & Analytics team, and the company as a whole, as we continue our rapid growth. You will become a go-to person for data questions, insights and recommendations for teams across the company, and will have the opportunity to support a single team that aligns with your long-term interests and our needs as an organization.  Within one month you will:   Complete your new hire onboarding checklist  Become more familiar with our product and value propositions by completing demos and other training sessions  Onboard onto our current company metrics and reporting, OKRs and the data infrastructure  Meet with all members of the Data & Analytics and Business Operations teams, as well as other members of teams you will be supporting (such as Marketing Teams, Sales Operations, Customer Engineering, and Product Managers)  Complete an onboarding project that reinforces your learnings from the first month (e.g. work with the marketing ops team to understand performance targets and how to standardize and centralize tracking for reporting)   Within three months you will:   Continue taking on projects within our Analytics roadmap that supports the marketing and customer facing teams in making great, informed decisions  Maintain weekly and monthly reports for various teams to understand progress towards and key variances in OKRs  Improve our data enablement efforts that make it easier for everyone across the company to onboard onto and effectively use our data tools  Begin taking on data questions from teams across the company   Within six months you will:   Become a go-to expert on our analytics stack to analyze and visualize data, and help others outside of the Analytics team do the same  Own and execute portions of the Analytics roadmap and OKRs, such as helping the marketing team understand key drivers of conversion and how to optimize for those drivers  Fill gaps as needed and help define the future state of a growing and lean Analytics organization!  About you  You are interested in driving business decisions with quantitative data and contributing to Sourcegraph's journey to be a data-informed organization. You are strongly aligned with our values, inspired by our mission to make it so that everyone can code, and motivated to do your best work at Sourcegraph.  Qualifications:   Demonstrated background (4-6 years) in analytical roles (analytics, operations, data engineering, data science, etc.)  Advanced experience working with SQL and Business Intelligence (BI) tools, such as Looker or Tableau  Independent self-starter who can prioritize and execute multiple tasks simultaneously in a fast-paced working environment  Excellent verbal/written communication and presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams  Familiarity with datasets from a multitude of sources, such as sales (Salesforce), marketing (HubSpot or Marketo), customer support (Zendesk)   Nice to haves:   Experience with ETL processes, software development and lifecycle awareness, using Python, Java, and AWS  Understanding of machine learning techniques  Knowledge of requirement gathering, documentation, and ensuring data quality  Interview process [~5 hour total interview]  Click here to read more information in our Handbook about  the types of interviews  we use at Sourcegraph.   You apply.  [30 min] Recruiter screen with Kelsey Nagel  [30 min] Hiring Manager screen with Lauren Anderson  In-depth Interview stage:  [45 min] Resume deep dive (aka Topgrade) with Lauren Anderson  [XX min ] Assignment (if applicable)  [1 hr] Assignment review/Technical Interview with Eric Brody-Moore & Adam Greenhalgh  [45 min] Cross-functional Collaboration with Kelsey Brown & Erica Freckelton  [30 min] Values interview  [30 min] Leadership interview with  Any other informal conversations with people who you would be working closely with but didn't get to meet during the interview process.  We check references & make you an offer  Not sure if this is you?  We want a diverse, global team, with a broad range of experience and perspectives. If this job sounds great, but you're not sure if you qualify, apply anyway! We carefully consider every application, and will either move forward with you, find another team that might be a better fit, keep in touch for future opportunities, or thank you for your time.  Learn more about us  To create a product that serves the needs of all developers, we are building a diverse all-remote team that is distributed across the world. Sourcegraph is an equal opportunity workplace; we welcome people from all backgrounds and communities.  We provide competitive compensation and practical benefits to keep you happy and healthy so that you can do your best work.  Learn more about what it is like to work at Sourcegraph by reading our handbook.  We want to ensure Sourcegraph is an environment that suits your working style and empowers you to do your best work, so we are eager to answer any questions that you have about us at any point in the interview process.  Go back to the careers page for all open positions.
